venue.name: New Britain Museum of American Art

item.description:
First Friday of each month from 5:30-8 p.m.
$5 for Museum members; $10 for non-members
$3 for beer and wine, soda is free

It has been a while since we have been here, come and enjoy the music and this amazing collection....

First Friday features live jazz music performed by local and nationally-known musicians, an opportunity to view the Museum’s premier permanent collection of 300 years of American art, gallery talks, art activities, a chance to mix and mingle with other art and jazz lovers, a selection of light hors d’oeuvres, and wine, beer, and soda.

 

RJ Rotolo & Speak No Evil
RJ Ruotolo - composer, drums
Michiro Negishi - piano
Keith Henderson - bass
George Rameriz - guitar
JD Herzog - saxophones
Pat Casey - trumpet
RJ Ruotolo & Speak No Evil perform classic music compositions in the jazz and blues genres as well as original music composed by RJ Ruotolo. Ruotolo has been a professional performing musician since age 15. He was educated at the renowned Berklee School of Music from 1969-1977, he holds a B.S. Degree in Music Performance and Music Education. Ruotolo has performed with great stars such as: Johnny Rae, Donald O'Conner, Martini & Rossi, Maury Amsterdam, Godfrey Cambridge, Caludio Roditi, and others. He is an ASACP composer. The group will perform two sets, the first consisting of jazz classic & blues selections. The second set will consist of original music composed by Ruotolo. His music is a blending of original ideas using traditional formatting. The group name "Speak No Evil " was established by Ruotolo in 2004, the group has recorded and performed in selected venues across Connecticut.
item.how_to_find_us: Meet in the front lobby will wear the bw scarf with piano keys
item.name: First Friday at NBMAA
